required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of an 8-week Posterior Shoulder Stretching Program on Varsity-level Overhead Athletes
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of an 8-week Posterior Shoulder Stretch Program on Varsity-level Overhead Athletes

lead_sponsor.agency: Shoulder & Upper Extremity Research Group of Edmonton

clinical_study.source: Shoulder & Upper Extremity Research Group of Edmonton

brief_summary.textblock: To Determine whether an eight-week posterior shoulder stretch was effective in increasing dominant arm internal rotation(IR) and horizontal adduction (HAd) range of motion (ROM) in a group of overhead athletes identified as having tightness of their posterior shoulder structures.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Shoulder internal rotation and horizontal adduction range of motion

secondary_outcome.measure: Rate of change in internal rotation and horizontal adduction range of motion

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- varsity level athletes involved in volleyball, tennis and swimming with internal rotation deficit of greater than or equal to 15 degrees
Exclusion Criteria:
- previous surgical procedure or fracture of either shoulder or presently receiving treatment for condition affecting either shoulder

overall_official.affiliation: Shoulder & Upper Extremity Research Group of Edmonton

facility.name: Department of Physical Therapy, Universiy of Alberta

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shoulder & Upper Extremity Research Group of Edmonton
responsible_party.investigator_title: Assistant Professor, PT, PhD, Dept of Physical Therapy
